content:
Here are the important links for LT2024:

  • Workshop details including the schedule are on the website: https://leanprover-community.github.io/lt2024/
  • Talks will take place on Zoom: https://brown.zoom.us/j/94792332977
  • Social time will take place on Gather: https://app.gather.town/app/B5N3GXDKzGy35gsA/Lean%20Together%202024

We ask that you not share the Zoom and Gather links publicly! If people are interested in joining the workshop, they should join this Zulip stream themselves.
I just successfully ran in to Joachim Breitner on Gather.
Oops, I thought it wasn't open until tomorrow -- but I guess it doesn't hurt!
I don't get researchseminars.org confirmation mail somehow, good that there's a separate Zoom access
The talks so far are now available on our YouTube channel. There is a playlist for Lean Together 2024.
I see now that my slides were not really full screen and thus were quite small. Sorry about that. It's probably due to the unusual screen resolution of the computer I used. I'll investigate.
It was still perfectly readable on my 14" laptop screen.
I usually share the window and not my screen to avoid that type of thing with virtual presentations
Though I guess then you end up with window chrome, which is also not ideal
And who knows what is lurking in other windows!
Another trick I've done in the past to avoid that with full-screen sharing is temporarily cripple my screen resolution in order to match the aspect ratio of my slides...
Today's first talk is beginning now!
Talks from Day 2 are now on the playlist.
The first talk of the day begins in four minutes - see you in Zoom!
Talks from Day 3 are now on the playlist.
Note that the FRO community meeting today will be on the same Zoom as all of our talks (https://brown.zoom.us/j/94792332977), not at its normal Google link.
Next talk will start very soon!
The talks should now all be online! Please let me or Rob know if you see any problems with names, titles, or content.
Thanks for the speedy movement on this! Teaching started this week for me and I had to miss a few of the talks -- I wanted to catch up on the rest of them ASAP.
@Scott Morrison could you put the link to the playlist on the LT2024 website?
@Rob Lewis, sorry I'll pass this one to you as I know nothing about the LT2024 website.
